module.name: Grids
module.short: Classes for displaying tabular data in the form of a grid of rows and columns

element.name: EGridException
element.short: EGridException - exception handler for an error in a Grid class

element.name: TStringCellEditor
element.short: TStringCellEditor - the default editor for TStringGrid

element.short: msg_SetMask - issues message for specifying mask

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SetGrid
element.short: msg_SetGrid - issues message for specifying grid

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SelectAll
element.short: msg_SelectAll - issues message for Selecting All

element.name: TVirtualGrid
element.short: TVirtualGrid - an array of rows and columns containing data, which never gets displayed

element.name: TVirtualGrid.doDestroyItem
element.short: doDestroyItem - method for destroying an Item at the given Row and Column location

element.name: TVirtualGrid.doNewItem
element.short: doNewItem - method for producing a new item at the given location specified by Row, Col

element.name: TVirtualGrid.DeleteColRow
element.short: DeleteColRow - remove either a column or a row, depending on the value of IsColumn

element.name: TVirtualGrid.MoveColRow
element.short: MoveColRow - move either a column or a row (depending on value of IsColumn) at FromIndex to the location ToIndex

element.name: TVirtualGrid.ExchangeColRow
element.short: ExchangeColRow - exchange either the current column or row (depending on the value of IsColumn) with the entity specified by WithIndex

element.name: TVirtualGrid.DisposeCell
element.short: DisposeCell - dispose of the resources and pointer for the given cell

element.name: TVirtualGrid.DisposeColRow
element.short: DisposeColRow - dispose of the specified row or column, freeing its pointer

element.name: TVirtualGrid.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TVirtualGrid: calls inherited Create then creates arrays of Cells, Columns and Rows; forms links for actions and event handlers

element.name: TVirtualGrid.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TVirtualGrid: frees rows, columns and cells, then cals inherited Destroy

element.name: TVirtualGrid.Clear
element.short: Clear the grid

element.name: TVirtualGrid.GetDefaultCell
element.short: GetDefaultCell - returns the properties of the default cell

element.name: TVirtualGrid.GetDefaultColRow
element.short: GetDefaultColRow - returns the properties of the default column and row

element.name: TVirtualGrid.ColCount
element.short: ColCount - the number of columns in the current grid

element.name: TVirtualGrid.RowCount
element.short: RowCount - the number of rows in the current grid

element.name: TVirtualGrid.Celda
element.short: Celda - the current cell as defined by its column and row

element.name: TVirtualGrid.Cols
element.short: Cols - the columns to which the grid applies

element.name: TVirtualGrid.Rows
element.short: The Rows to which the grid applies

element.name: TCustomGrid
element.short: TCustomGrid - the base class for all grid controls

descr.p: A grid is a collection of cells that are organized in columns and rows. Grids are suitable for showing data that have tabular nature, for example tables in a database, or formulae and data in a spreadsheet.
The ColCount and RowCount properties contain the column and row count of the grid.
The FixedCols and FixedRows properties specify the count of fixed columns or rows that are used for headings.
The column widths and row heights of the grid are accessible with the ColWidths and RowHeights properties.
The DefaultColWidth and DefaultRowHeight properties are used to specify default column widths or row heights respectively.

The colors of the cells and the grid elements are specified with the AlternateColor, BorderColor, FixedColor, FixedHotColor, FocusColor, GridLineColor and SelectedColor properties. The GridWidth and GridHeight properties contain the dimension of the entire grid.
The ScrollBars property controls the creation of scrollbars for the grid.
The LeftCol, TopRow, VisibleColCount and VisibleRowCount properties contain information about the visible area of the grid.
The Options property controls options for the grid.
If the user highlights a cell of the grid, the SelectCell method is called that triggers the OnSelectCell event. The position of the highlighted cell is stored within the Col and Row property.
The MouseToCell method calculates a grid cell from a given screen position.
Huge changes to the grid should be encapsulated in calls to BeginUpdate and EndUpdate to speed up the application.
Component developers must override the DrawCell method in customized grids.

element.name: TCustomGrid.AutoAdjustColumn
element.short: AutoAdjustColumn - automatically adjust column properties to accommodate largest object

element.name: TCustomGrid.BeforeMoveSelection
element.short: BeforeMoveSelection - method to use before a selection is moved
element.descr:
This method is called from TCustomGrid.MoveExtend method whenever the current grid cursor location is about to change. The destination column and row are specified in DCol and DRow parameters respectively.
The new location is known to be a valid selectable cell (see ), and is given in absolute cell coordinates. At this point the current grid location has not changed and can be retrieved with Col and Row properties.
The purpose of this method is to call event handler OnBeforeSelection.

element.short: CalcAutoSizeColumn - method for automatically calculating the size of a column

element.short: ColRowToOffset - method for moving column or row (depending on value of IsCol); if Relative is True, moves by the amount of Index, otherwise moves from StartPos to EndPos. Returns True if successful

TCustomGrid.ScrollBarPage

element.name: TCustomGrid.ScrollBarShow
element.short: ScrollBarShow method
element.descr:
Change the appearance of the scrollbars in the grid.
'Which' can be any of : SB_BOTH, SB_VERT, SB_HORZ 'aValue' can be True or False

element.name: TCustomGrid.ScrollBarAutomatic
element.short: ScrollBarAutomatic method
element.descr:
Check if scrollbars are shown automatically by the grid or not.
'Which' can be any of : SB_BOTH, SB_VERT, SB_HORZ

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectEditor
element.short: SelectEditor - chooses the editor for current use

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectCell
element.short: Is called if a grid cell is highlighted.

descr.p: The SelectCell method is called if a grid cell will be highlighted.
The aCol and aRow parameters contain the column and the row of the highlighted cell.

Component developers may use the SelectCell method to react on focus changes. The Result is true if the cell is allowed to be selected. Application developers should use the OnSelectCell event instead.

element.name: TCustomGrid.SetBorderStyle
element.short: SetBorderStyle - specifies a new border style

element.name: TCustomGrid.SetFixedcolor
element.short: SetFixedcolor - specifies colour for fixed cells

element.name: TCustomGrid.SetSelectedColor
element.short: SetSelectedColor - specifies colour for cells that have been selected

element.name: TCustomGrid.SizeChanged
element.short: SizeChanged - specifies the old number of columns and rows

element.name: TCustomGrid.Sort
element.short: Sort method

descr.p: Method to sort all items in the grid
If ColSorting is True, sorts the items in a column; otherwise sorts a row
The three given indexes specify the items to be sorted

element.name: TCustomGrid.TopLeftChanged
element.short: TopLeftChanged - the top left cell has changed

element.name: TCustomGrid.TryMoveSelection
element.short: TryMoveSelection - attempts to move the selection by the specified offset; returns True if sucessful

element.name: TCustomGrid.UpdateHorzScrollBar
element.short: UpdateHorzScrollBar - updates the scrollbar in the given range by the given page, if it is visible

element.name: TCustomGrid.UpdateVertScrollbar
element.short: UpdateVertScrollbar - updates the scrollbar in the given range by the given page, if it is visible

element.name: TCustomGrid.VisualChange
element.short: VisualChange - a change in the visual properties

element.name: TCustomGrid.WMHScroll
element.short: WMHScroll - system message for horizontal scrolling

element.name: TCustomGrid.WMVScroll
element.short: WMVScroll - system message for vertical scrolling

element.name: TCustomGrid.AutoAdvance
element.short: Automatically advance down the grid on successive mouse clicks or presses of the ENTER or TAB key

element.name: TCustomGrid.AutoFillColumns
element.short: Automatically resize columns so they fill all grid's visible area

descr.p: When this option is turned on, the grid will resize all columns to fill the grid's client width. What columns are resized is determined by the following conditions:
1. Fixed Columns are not resized. 2. If the grid has Custom Columns, all columns with SizePriority=0 are not resized.
Note that Custom Columns are initially created with SizePriority=1. For TDbGrid, which automatically adds Custom Columns, this means the user will not be able to resize such columns using the mouse.

element.name: TCustomGrid.BorderStyle
element.descr: Only a restricted series of options is available: none or a single border.

element.name: TCustomGrid.Col
element.short: Current column index.
element.descr: Col property holds the column index of the current grid cell cursor. The current grid column can be changed programatically by setting a new value to this property.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColCount
element.short: Number of columns of the grid.
element.descr: This is the number of columns in the grid, including fixed and normal columns.

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColWidths
element.short: Column widths for the grid.

descr.p: The column is specified with the aCol parameter. The aCol parameter must fall within the valid index range of 0 to ColCount-1.
The return value of the property is the width of this column, measured in pixels.
The initial width of a newly created column is specified with the DefaultColWidth property. After that the user may redefine this value.
If the Options property includes the appropriate value, the column width may also be changed by the user at runtime.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultColWidth
element.short: Default value for the width of newly created grid columns.

descr.p: If new columns of the grid are created by changing the ColCount property, the width of these new columns will be set to the value of the DefaultColWidth property.
After that the user may redefine this value. If the Options property includes the appropriate value, the column width may also be changed by the user at runtime.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultRowHeight
element.short: Default value for the height of newly created grid rows.

descr.p: If new rows of the grid are created by changing the RowCount property, the height of these new rows will be set to the value of the DefaultRowHeight property.
After that the user may redefine this value. If the Options property includes the appropriate value, the row height may also be changed by the user at runtime.

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultDrawing
element.short: Is the default drawing method to be used for this grid? Default is TRUE

element.name: TCustomGrid.DefaultTextStyle
element.short: Default style for displaying text - includes alignment, layout, single or multi-lines

element.name: TCustomGrid.DragDx
element.short: DragDx - the amount (DeltaX) by which an object should be dragged

element.name: TCustomGrid.Editor
element.short: The editor to be used for modifying information in the cells of the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorMode
element.short: Is grid ready to accept edits? (EditorMode True)

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorKey
element.short: EditorKey - is the current key available to the editor?

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorShowing
element.short: Is the editor for the grid displayed?

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedCols
element.short: Number of the fixed columns of the grid (ie the columns containing title or identifier material, that don't get scrolled when the rest of the grid moves).

descr.p: Contains the fixed column count of a grid.
Fixed columns are normally used for headings.

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedRows
element.short: Number of the fixed rows of the grid (ie the rows containing title or identifier material, that don't get scrolled when the rest of the grid moves).

descr.p: Contains the fixed row count of a grid.
Fixed rows are normally used for headings.

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedColor
element.short: The color for the fixed cells of the grid.

element.name: TCustomGrid.Flat
element.short: Is the cell to be displayed Flat, ie with no texturing or raised/lowered effect

element.name: TCustomGrid.FocusColor
element.short: The colour to be used for the cell receiving focus

element.name: TCustomGrid.FocusRectVisible
element.short: FocusRectVisible - is the rectangle receiving focus visible?

element.name: TCustomGrid.GCache
element.short: GCache - the cache to be used for grid data

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridHeight
element.short: GridHeight - the height of the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridLineColor
element.short: Colour to be used for GridLines

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridLineStyle
element.short: Style to be used for GridLines

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridLineWidth
element.short: Width (thickness) of GridLines

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridWidth
element.short: Width of the whole Grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.LeftCol
element.short: LeftCol - the left-most column

element.name: TCustomGrid.Options
element.short: The options available for use in this grid
element.descr: For a list of options see

element.name: TCustomGrid.Row
element.short: The current Row (record) within the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.RowCount
element.short: Number of rows in the grid
element.descr: This is the number of rows in the grid, including fixed and normal rows.

element.name: TCustomGrid.RowHeights
element.short: The row heights for the grid.

descr.p: The row is specified with the aRow parameter. The aRow parameter must fall within the valid index range of 0 to RowCount-1.
The return value of the property is the height of this row, measured in pixels.

The initial height of a newly created row is specified with the DefaultRowHeight property. After that the user may redefine this value. If the Options property includes the appropriate value, the row height may also be changed by the user at runtime.

element.name: TCustomGrid.SaveOptions
element.short: The set of options for saving information from the grid (design, attributes, content or position)

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectActive
element.short: SelectActive - if True, the current active cell is selected

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectedColor
element.short: Colour to be used for selected cells

element.name: TCustomGrid.Selection
element.short: The current selection (rows and columns) in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.ScrollBars
element.short: The ScrollBars to be used with this grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.TopRow
element.short: The first row (record) in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.VisibleColCount
element.short: The number of visible columns

element.name: TCustomGrid.VisibleRowCount
element.short: The number of visible rows

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnBeforeSelection
element.short: OnBeforeSelection - event handler for use before a selection is made

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnCompareCells
element.short: Event handler for comparing the contents of grid cells

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnPrepareCanvas
element.short: Event handler to prepare the Canvas for drawing

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnDrawCell
element.short: Event handler for drawing a cell

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnSelection
element.short: Event handler for when an area of a grid (one or a group of cells) is selected
element.descr:
The Col and Row parameters contain the column and the row of the highlighted cell.
Application developers may use the OnSelection and OnBeforeSelection events to react on focus changes. Component developers should use the method instead.

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnSelectEditor
element.short: Event handler for selecting an editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnTopLeftChanged
element.short: Event handler when the top left cell is changed (ie the grid has been scrolled so that a different cell occupies top left)

element.name: TCustomGrid.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomGrid: calls inherited Create, then creates lists of columns and rows, initialises many visual properties and options, creates the various editors and loads any bitmaps required for the display

descr.p: // Inherited create Calls SetBounds->WM_SIZE->VisualChange so
// fGrid needs to be created before that

element.name: TCustomGrid.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TCustomGrid: frees various resources including editors, columns, rows, font then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TCustomGrid.AutoAdjustColumns
element.short: AutoAdjustColumns - automatically adjust the columns according to the size of their contents

element.name: TCustomGrid.BeginUpdate
element.short: Begin updating the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.CellRect
element.short: The coordinates of the current cell (column, row) expressed as a standard rectangle (TRect)

element.name: TCustomGrid.Clear
element.short: Clear all cells from the grid.

descr.p: Reset Column and Row counts to 0. Grid is completely emptied.
Compatibility: This property applies to Lazarus grids only , under Delphi/Kylix a grid can't be completely emptied.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorExit
element.short: Leave the cell editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorKeyDown
element.short: Emulate the OnKeyDown event handler in the cell editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorKeyPress
element.short: Emulate the OnKeyPress event handler in the cell editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorKeyUp
element.short: Emulate the OnKeyUp event handler in the cell editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.EndUpdate
element.short: EndUpdate - Finish updating the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.EndUpdate
element.short: EndUpdate - Finish updating the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.IscellSelected
element.short: IsCellSelected - is the cell specified by aCol, aRow selected?

element.name: TCustomGrid.IscellVisible
element.short: Finds out whether a particular cell is visible

element.name: TCustomGrid.LoadFromFile
element.short: Load the grid data from a file with the specified name

element.name: TCustomGrid.MouseToCell
element.short: Convert mouse coordinates to the position of a cell in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.MouseToCell
element.short: Convert mouse coordinates to the position of a cell in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.MouseToLogcell
element.short: Convert mouse coordinates to the position of a logical cell in the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.MouseToGridZone
element.short: MouseToGridZone - convert muse coordinates to a gid zone

element.name: TCustomGrid.SaveToFile
element.short: Save the data in the grid to a file with specified name

element.name: TDrawGrid
element.short: TDrawGrid - a drawn grid. May contain images in its cells

element.name: TStringGrid
element.short: TStringGrid - a specialised grid for displaying strings (text material) in a matrix of columns and rows

element.name: DrawRubberRect
element.short: Draw rubberband rect
element.descr: Draw a rubberband around the provided cellrect Segunda linea de texto

element.name: TGridColumn
element.short: TGridColumn - a column of similar data items in a grid

element.name: TButtonCellEditor
element.short: TButtonCellEditor - the editor for button cells in a grid

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_SetGrid
element.short: msg_SetGrid - issues message for specifying grid

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_SetPos
element.short: msg_SetPos - issues message for specifying position

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.Col
element.short: Col - the column in which the edited cell resides

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.Row
element.short: Row - the row in which the edited cell resides

element.name: TPickListCellEditor
element.short: TPickListCellEditor - the editor for a picklist cell in a grid

element.name: TPickListCellEditor.msg_GetValue
element.short: msg_GetValue - issues a message to find the value

element.name: TPickListCellEditor.msg_SetGrid
element.short: msg_SetGrid - issues a message to specify the grid

element.name: TPickListCellEditor.msg_SetValue
element.short: msg_SetValue - issues a message to specify the value

element.name: TVirtualGrid.InsertColRow
element.short: InsertColRow - insert either a column or a row (depending on value of IsColumn) at the specified index position

element.name: TGridColumnTitle
element.short: TGridColumnTitle - the title for a column in a grid

descr.p: TGridColumnTitle - the title for a column in a grid
The actual title is held in Caption
Column refers to the Grid Column to which the Title is attached

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.GetDefaultCaption
element.short: GetDefaultCaption - returns th e default caption for this column

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.GetDefaultAlignment
element.short: GetDefaultAlignment - returns the default alignment

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.GetDefaultColor
element.short: GetDefaultColor - returns the default colour

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.GetDefaultLayout
element.short: GetDefaultLayout - returns the default layout

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.SetCaption
element.short: SetCaption - specifies the caption to use (rather than using default)

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TGridColumnTitle: calls inherited Create then links the column, creates and configures the default font

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TGridColumnTitle: frees forn, disconnects alignments, disposes of captions and colours then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.FillTitleDefaultFont
element.short: FillTitleDefaultFont - use the default font for the whole of the title

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.IsDefault
element.short: IsDefault - returns True if this is the default title

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.Column
element.short: The Column to which the title applies

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.Alignment
element.short: The Alignment (whether justified or centred) for this title

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.Layout
element.short: The Layout for the text of the title

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.Caption
element.short: The Caption for this title

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.Color
element.short: The Color to use for this title

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.Font
element.short: The Font for this title

element.name: TGridColumn.GetPickList
element.short: GetPickList - returns the picklist as a list of strings

element.name: TGridColumn.GetDefaultAlignment
element.short: GetDefaultAlignment - returns the default alignment

element.name: TGridColumn.GetDefaultColor
element.short: GetDefaultColor - returns the default colour

element.name: TGridColumn.GetDefaultLayout
element.short: GetDefaultLayout - returns the default layout for text

element.name: TGridColumn.GetDefaultMaxSize
element.short: GetDefaultMaxSize -returns the default maximum size

element.name: TGridColumn.GetDefaultMinSize
element.short: GetDefaultMinSize - returns the default minimum size

element.name: TGridColumn.GetDefaultReadOnly
element.short: GetDefaultReadOnly - returns the default value for the ReadOnly property

element.name: TGridColumn.GetDefaultSizePriority
element.short: GetDefaultSizePriority - returns the default value for size priority

element.name: TGridColumn.GetDefaultVisible
element.short: GetDefaultVisible - returns the default value for the Visible property

element.name: TGridColumn.GetDefaultWidth
element.short: GetDefaultWidth - returns the default value for width

element.name: TGridColumn.ColumnChanged
element.short: ColumnChanged - method for dealing with change of column

element.name: TGridColumn.AllColumnsChange
element.short: AllColumnsChange - method for processing a change in all columns

element.name: TGridColumn.CreateTitle
element.short: CreateTitle - creates a column title and returns it in the result

element.name: TGridColumn.IsDefaultFont
element.short: IsDefaultFont - if True, the default font is being used

element.name: TGridColumn.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TGridColumn: calls inherited Create, then creates a title and font, initialises a picklist and sets styles

element.name: TGridColumn.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TGridColumn: disposes of various local variables, frees picklist, font and title, then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TGridColumn.FillDefaultFont
element.short: FillDefaultFont - method to fill all cells in the column with the default font

element.name: TGridColumn.IsDefault
element.short: IsDefault - returns True if this column is the default

element.name: TGridColumn.Grid
element.short: The Grid to which this column belongs

element.name: TGridColumn.WidthChanged
element.short: WidthChanged - if True, width has been changed

element.name: TGridColumn.Alignment

element.name: TGridColumn.ButtonStyle
element.short: ButtonStyle - the style of any column button

element.name: TGridColumn.Color
element.short: the Color for this column

element.name: TGridColumn.DropDownRows

element.name: TGridColumn.Expanded
element.short: Whether the column has been Expanded

element.name: TGridColumn.Font
element.short: The Font for the column

element.name: TGridColumn.Layout

element.name: TGridColumn.MinSize
element.short: MinSize - the minimum size

element.name: TGridColumn.MaxSize

element.name: TGridColumn.PickList
element.short: PickList - the list of items selected from this column

element.name: TGridColumn.ReadOnly
element.short: ReadOnly - if True, only reading (not writing) is allowed

element.name: TGridColumn.SizePriority
element.short: SizePriority - the value of the size priority in the sorted order

element.name: TGridColumn.Title
element.short: The Title for the column

element.name: TGridColumn.Width
element.short: The Width of the column

element.name: TGridColumn.Visible
element.short: Visible - if True, the column can be seen (ie not hidden)

element.name: TGridColumns
element.short: TGridColumns - the group of columns in the grid

element.name: TGridColumns.TitleFontChanged

element.name: TGridColumns.FontChanged

element.name: TGridColumns.RemoveColumn

element.name: TGridColumns.MoveColumn
element.short: MoveColumn from the first index to the second

element.name: TGridColumns.ExchangeColumn
element.short: ExchangeColumn - exchange the position of the current column with the specified other column

element.name: TGridColumns.InsertColumn
element.short: InsertColumn with the specified index

element.name: TGridColumns.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TGridColumns: calls inherited Create then loads the grid

element.name: TGridColumns.RealIndex
element.short: RealIndex - the proper index for this column
element.descr: Real in this sense means proper or correct, not a Real number (as it is specified as an integer)

element.name: TGridColumns.IndexOf
element.short: IndexOf this column

element.name: TGridColumns.IsDefault
element.short: IsDefault returns True if this is the default column

element.name: TGridColumns.HasIndex
element.short: HasIndex - returns True if the current column has an index value

element.name: TGridColumns.VisibleIndex
element.short: VisibleIndex - the index value of a visible column

element.name: TGridColumns.Grid

element.name: TGridColumns.Items
element.short: Items - the list of columns in this collection

element.name: TGridColumns.VisibleCount

element.name: TGridColumns.Enabled

element.name: TCustomGrid.CanEditShow

element.name: TCustomGrid.CanGridAcceptKey

element.name: TCustomGrid.CheckLimitsWithError

element.name: TCustomGrid.CMMouseLeave

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColRowInserted

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColumnIndexFromGridColumn

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColumnFromGridColumn

element.name: TCustomGrid.ColumnsChanged
element.short: ColumnsChanged - method for dealing with changed columns

element.name: TCustomGrid.CreateColumns
element.short: CreateColumns - returns the identity of the created columns

element.name: TCustomGrid.CheckNewCachedSizes
element.short: CheckNewCachedSizes - check the new values of cached sizes

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoCompareCells
element.short: DoCompareCells - perform the comparison of two or more cells in a grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoCopyToClipboard
element.short: DoCopyToClipboard - copy the selected data to the clipboard, leaving the original data in place

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoCutToClipboard
element.short: DoCutToClipboard - cut the data from its current site and place it on the clipboard

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoEditorHide
element.short: DoEditorHide - hide the data in the editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoEditorShow
element.short: DoEditorShow - show the data in the editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoOPDeleteColRow
element.short: DoOPDeleteColRow performs the operation for deleting a column or row (depending on value of IsCol)

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoOPExchangeColRow
element.short: DoOPExchangeColRow - perform the operation for exchanging either the current column or row (depending on value of IsCol) with the column or row specified by WithIndex

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoOPInsertColRow
element.short: DoOPInsertColRow - perform th eoperation for inserting either a column or a row (depending on the value of IsCol) at th indexed position

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoOPMoveColRow
element.short: DoOPMoveColRow - performs the operation for moving either a column or a row (depending on the value of IsCol) between FromIndex and ToIndex

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoPasteFromClipboard
element.short: DoPasteFromClipboard paste the data from the clipboard to the current location

element.name: TCustomGrid.DoPrepareCanvas
element.short: DoPrepareCanvas - get the canvas ready for drawing

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawAllRows
element.short: DrawAllRows - draws all the rows

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawCellText
element.short: DrawCellText - draws the given text string in the cell specified by Col, Row or by Rectangle

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawColumnText
element.short: DrawColumnText - draw the text of the specified column

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditButtonClicked
element.short: EditButtonClicked - calls OnEditButtonClick

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorLocked
element.short: EditorLocked - returns True if the Editor is locked, ie unable to accept input or make changes

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorShowInCell
element.short: EditorShowInCell - shows the Editor's content in situ in the Cell

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorWidthChanged
element.short: EditorWidthChanged - method for dealing with a change in editor width

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedGrid
element.short: FixedGrid - returns True if the Grid is fixed

element.name: TCustomGrid.FontChanged
element.short: FontChanged - method to deal with a change in font

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetColumnAlignment

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetColumnColor
element.short: GetColumnColor - returns the Colour for the specified column

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetColumnFont
element.short: GetColumnFont - returns the font for the specified column

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetColumnLayout
element.short: GetColumnLayout - returns the Text Layout value for the specified column

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetColumnReadonly
element.short: GetColumnReadonly - returns True if the column is marked ReadOnly

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetColumnTitle
element.short: GetColumnTitle - returns the column title string

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetColumnWidth
element.short: GetColumnWidth - returns the width of the column

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetDeltaMoveNext
element.short: GetDeltaMoveNext return the relative cell coordinate of the next cell to which movement will occur

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetDefaultColumnAlignment
element.short: GetDefaultColumnAlignment - returns the default alignment for the specified column

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetDefaultColumnWidth
element.short: GetDefaultColumnWidth - returns the default width for the specified column

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetDefaultColumnLayout
element.short: GetDefaultColumnLayout - returns the default text layout for the nominated column

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetDefaultColumnReadOnly
element.short: GetDefaultColumnReadOnly - returns the default setting of the ReadOnly flag for the specified column

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetDefaultColumnTitle

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetDefaultEditor
element.short: GetDefaultEditor - returns the default editor for the specified column

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetDefaultRowHeight

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetScrollBarPosition
element.short: GetScrollBarPosition - returns the position of the scroll bar specified by Which

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetSBVisibility
element.short: GetSBVisibility - finds the values of the visibility flags for the scrollbars

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetSBRanges
element.short: GetSBRanges - finds the ranges of values for the scrollbars, if they are visible

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridColumnFromColumnIndex
element.short: GridColumnFromColumnIndex - returns the number of the column given its column index

element.name: TCustomGrid.InternalSetColCount
element.short: InternalSetColCount - specify the column count

element.name: TCustomGrid.InvalidateRange
element.short: InvalidateRange - render a range of the grid non-valid

element.name: TCustomGrid.InvalidateFromCol
element.short: InvalidateFromCol - render the grid non-valid from the specified column onwards

element.name: TCustomGrid.InvalidateFocused

element.name: TCustomGrid.GetIsCellSelected
element.short: GetIsCellSelected - returns True if the given cell is selected

element.name: TCustomGrid.LockEditor
element.short: LockEditor - lock the editor so that it will not accept input or changes

element.name: TCustomGrid.PickListItemSelected
element.short: PickListItemSelected - indicates that an item was selected from the pick-list

element.name: TCustomGrid.ResetEditor
element.short: ResetEditor - resets the current editor for the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.ResetSizes
element.short: ResetSizes - resets the sizes

element.name: TCustomGrid.ResizeColumn
element.short: ResizeColumn - resizes the nominated column to the specified width

element.name: TCustomGrid.ResizeRow
element.short: ResizeRow - resizes the nominated row to the specified height

element.name: TCustomGrid.ScrollBarIsVisible
element.short: ScrollBarIsVisible - Returns True if visible; Which determines whether horizontal or vertical

element.name: TCustomGrid.SetCanvasFont
element.short: SetCanvasFont to specified value

element.name: TCustomGrid.SetColor
element.short: SetColor to specified value

element.name: TCustomGrid.SetColRow
element.short: SetColRow - specifies the column and row for addressing

element.name: TCustomGrid.UnLockEditor
element.short: UnLockEditor - frees a previously locked Editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.UpdateBorderStyle
element.short: UpdateBorderStyle - brings the border style up to date

element.name: TCustomGrid.AllowOutboundEvents
element.short: AllowOutboundEvents - permits mouse click on an imaginary (out-of-bounds) cell; moves cursor to nearest valid cell

descr.p: Normally when a user clicks on a point over the empty space after cells (for example if grid has three rows but user clicks on imaginary fourth row) the current focused cell will move to the nearest cell to clicked point; we call this an outbound event.
Default value is true, as this has been the grid's behaviour since the beginning.
This property was added to simulate Delphi behaviour where outbound events are not available; to enable Delphi compatibility set this property to false.

element.name: TCustomGrid.AlternateColor
element.short: The colour to be used for the background on alternate rows of the grid. Having alternate rows in different colours can make the grid easier to read.

element.name: TCustomGrid.AutoEdit
element.short: Whether the Edit mode is automatically entered when a cell is selected

element.name: TCustomGrid.BorderColor
element.short: The colour of the border for this control

element.name: TCustomGrid.Columns
element.short: The properties of the columns in this grid

descr.p: The Columns property of a grid refers to the physical column in the table, and determines its size, shape, colour etc. It should not be confused with the COLUMNS construct frequently used in SQL programming, which refers to Fields of data. The contents of Fields can be displayed as Columns in a Grid, but they must be seen as separate and distinct. It is irrelevant to refer to the colour, font or width of a data field from a database, but these are all very relevant in specifying the appearance of a column in a grid.

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorBorderStyle
element.short: The border style for the editor used in this grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorOptions
element.short: The set of options available for the grid's editor

element.name: TCustomGrid.ExtendedColSizing
element.short: ExtendedColSizing - the sizing to be used for extended columns

element.name: TCustomGrid.ExtendedRowSizing
element.short: ExtendedRowSizing - the sizing to be used for extended rows

element.name: TCustomGrid.ExtendedSelect
element.short: ExtendedSelect - the ability to select cells beyond the boundary of the visible part of the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.FastEditing
element.short: Is the FastEditing method being used?

element.name: TCustomGrid.AltColorStartNormal
element.short: AltColorStartNormal - using a second colour to display alternate rows, but starting the first row with the normal colour

descr.p: AltColorStartNormal - using a second colour to display alternate rows, but starting the first row with the normal colour
Using a different colour for the background of alternate rows often makes the data in a grid much easier to read

element.name: TCustomGrid.FixedHotColor
element.short: FixedHotColor - the 'Hot' colour for the active (selected, etc) fixed cells of the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.GridFlags
element.short: GridFlags - the flags that are set for the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.HeaderHotZones
element.short: HeaderHotZones - the zones of the header that are under the cursor, so are capable of being selected or pushed (or not!)

element.name: TCustomGrid.HeaderPushZones
element.short: HeaderPushZones - the zones of the header that have been selected by the cursor, or pushed

element.name: TCustomGrid.InplaceEditor
element.short: InplaceEditor - the editor to be used in-place, ie in the cell itself instead of outside the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.SelectedColumn
element.short: The column (field) currently selected

element.name: TCustomGrid.StrictSort
element.short: StrictSort - is strict sorting to be used?

element.name: TCustomGrid.TitleFont
element.short: The font to be used in the grid's title

element.name: TCustomGrid.TitleStyle
element.short: The style to be used for the grid's title

element.name: TCustomGrid.UseXORFeatures
element.short: UseXORFeatures: When True, the dotted focus rectangle is painted using the XOR raster operation

descr.p: This property controls how the dotted focus rectangle appears in the grid. When True, the rectangle is painted using the XOR raster operation. This allow us to see the focus rectangle no matter what the cells' background color is. When False, the user can control the color of the dotted focus rectangle using the FocusColor property

It also controls the look of the column/row resizing. When True, a line shows visually the size that the the column or row will have if the user ends the operation. When False, the column or row resizing takes effect just as the user drags the mouse

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnEditButtonClick
element.short: Event handler for when the Edit button is clicked

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnPickListSelect
element.short: Event handler for selecting an item from a picklist (eg drop-down list in TComboBox)

element.name: TCustomGrid.CellToGridZone
element.short: Convert the coordinates of the current cell (col, row) to a grid zone

element.name: TCustomGrid.CheckPosition
element.short: Check the position of the cursor

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditorByStyle
element.short: Select a cell editor control with the specified style

element.name: TCustomGrid.EraseBackground
element.short: Clear the background to the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.MouseCoord
element.short: Find the mouse coordinates relative to the grid origin

element.name: TCustomGrid.SetFocus
element.short: Set focus on the grid

element.name: TCustomGrid.SortOrder
element.short: Order of sorting - ascending or descending

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid
element.short: TCustomDrawGrid - Base Class for drawn grids including TDrawGrid and TStringGrid

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.FGrid
element.short: FGrid - local variable holding a virtual grid on which to work

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.CalcCellExtent
element.short: CalcCellExtent - calculate the dimensions required for the cell specified by aCol, aRow

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.CreateVirtualGrid
element.short: CreateVirtualGrid - returns the created virtual grid

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.DrawCellAutonumbering
element.short: DrawCellAutonumbering - draws a cell using auto numbering

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.DrawFocusRect
element.short: DrawFocusRect - draws the rectangle currently receiving focus

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.NotifyColRowChange
element.short: NotifyColRowChange tells the system that a column or row has been changed (determined by IsColumn) and whether this was an Insert

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomDrawGrid: attaches a virtual grid then calls inherited Create

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TCustomDrawGrid: frees the grid then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.DeleteColRow
element.short: Delete either a column or a row (specified by index), depending on the value of the boolean IsColumn

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.ExchangeColRow
element.short: Exchange either a column or a row, specified by index, with the col or row specified by WithIndex; boolean IsColumn determines whether rows or columns are to be exchanged

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.InsertColRow
element.short: InsertColRow inserts a column or row (specified by Iscolumn) at the stated index location

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.MoveColRow
element.short: Move column or row from FromIndex to ToIndex; boolean IsColumn specifies whether col or row is to be moved

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.SortColRow
element.short: Sort column or row specified by index and optionally by FromIndex and ToIndex; IsColumn specifies whether col or row is to be sorted

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.DefaultDrawCell
element.short: Use the default method for drawing a cell specified by aCol, aRow, at location aRect with state aState

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnColRowDeleted
element.short: Event handler when a grid column or row is deleted

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnColRowExchanged
element.short: Event handler when a grid column or row has its position exchanged with another

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnColRowInserted
element.short: Event handler when a column or row is inserted into the grid

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnColRowMoved
element.short: Event handler when a grid column or row is moved

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnCompareCells
element.short: Event handler for comparing the contents of cells

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnGetEditMask
element.short: Event handler for finding the edit mask while editing a grid cell

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnGetEditText
element.short: Event handler for finding the text to be edited in a grid cell

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnHeaderClick
element.short: Event handler when a column or row header is clicked

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnHeaderSized
element.short: Event handler when a column or row header is re-sized

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnSelectCell
element.short: Event handler when a grid cell is selected

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnSetEditText
element.short: Event handler for storing the text that has been edited in a cell

element.name: TDrawGrid.HeaderHotZones
element.short: HeaderHotZones - the header zones corresponding to the position of the mouse cursor

element.name: TDrawGrid.HeaderPushZones
element.short: HeaderPushZones - the zones of the header that have been pushed down (selected)

element.name: TCustomStringGrid
element.short: TCustomStringGrid - base class for TStringGrid

element.name: TStringGridStrings
element.short: TStringGridStrings - the strings that populate the cells of a TStringGrid
element.descr: All of the properties are defined in the ancestor classes (TStrings etc)

element.name: TStringGridStrings.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TStringGridStrings: calls inherited Create and initialises some local variables

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.SelectionSetText
element.short: SelectionSetText - stores the text in the selection

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.Modified
element.short: Whether or not the current cell has been Modified

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomStringGrid: calls inherited Create then sets up default styles, layout and alignment

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TCustomStringGrid: frees maps of columns and rows, then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.AutoSizeColumn
element.short: AutoSizeColumn - automatically adjust width of column to accommodate widest text

descr.p: This procedure sets the column width to the size of the widest text it finds in all rows for the column aCol.
Tip: see the goDblClickAutoSize option to allow columns to be automatically resized when doubleClicking the column border.

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.AutoSizeColumns
element.short: AutoSizeColumns - automatically resizes all columns by adjusting them to fit in the longest text in each column
element.descr: Automatically resizes all columns by adjusting them to fit in the longest text in each column. This is a quick method of applying AutoSizeColumn() for every column in the grid.

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.Clean
element.short: Clean all cells in the grid subject to the given CleanOptions, optionally specifying a range of cells or a rectangular region.

descr.p: Cleans all cells in the grid subject to the given CleanOptions, optionally specifying a range of cells or a rectangular region. See for more information.
Some examples:

ul.li: Clean all cells: grid.Clean([]); (the same as grid.clean)
Clean all non fixed cells: grid.Clean([gzNormal]);
Clean all cells but don't touch grid column headers: Grid.Clean([gzNormal, gzFixedRows]);

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.Cells
element.short: Cells - the text content of a cell or cells, indexed by aCol, aRow

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.Cols
element.short: Cols - get or set a list of strings for column names as specified by the index

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.Objects
element.short: The Objects present in the specified cell

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.Rows
element.short: Rows - gets or sets a list of strings for row names as specified by index

element.name: TStringGrid.HeaderHotZones
element.short: HeaderHotZones - the header zones corresponding to the position of the mouse cursor

element.name: TStringGrid.HeaderPushZones
element.short: HeaderPushZones - the zones of the header that have been pushed down (selected)

element.name: TCustomStringGrid.CopyToClipboard
element.short: CopyToClipboard - copy a range of cells to clipboard
element.descr:
This method will copy a range of cells into the clipboard, the cells values are TAB separated.
The range is defined based on optional AUseSelection parameter which is false by default and which means the range is set to the whole grid, including fixed cols/rows. If AUseSelection is true, the range of cells is set to current

topic.name: HowToUseGrids
topic.short: How to use Grids including StringGrids, DrawGrids and DbGrids

descr.p: How to use Grids including StringGrids, DrawGrids and DbGrids

Grid are components derived from the TCustomControl class and don't have a native widget associated with them, so they are not restricted by the look of the current interface theme. This can be both an advantage and a disadvantage: usually programmers want to create a uniform-look application. Lazarus grids are flexible enough to allow programmers to make them look similar to other native controls; alternatively they can customize the grid to obtain almost the same look in any platform or widget interface (with the exception of scrollbars, whose look is still determined by the current theme).

Some properties can affect the way the grid looks by acting when the cell is about to be painted in PrepareCanvas/OnPrepareCanvas by changing default canvas properties like brush color or font. Following is a list of such properties:

table.caption: Properties and Events for customizing grids

tr.td: AlternateColor
The user can change the background color that appears on alternate rows. This is to allow easy reading of grid rows data.
Color
Sets the primary color used to draw non fixed cells' background.
FixedColor
The color used to draw fixed cells' background.
Flat
Eliminates the 3d look of fixed cells.
TitleFont
Font used to draw the text in fixed cells.
TitleStyle

Changes the 3D look of fixed cells. There are 3 settings:
tsLazarus The default look
tsNative Tries to set a look that is in concordance with current widgetset theme.
tsStandard A more contrasted look, like Delphi grids.
AltColorStartNormal

(Boolean). If true, alternate color is always in the second row after fixed rows; the first row after fixed rows will always be the default color. If false, default color is set to the first row as if there were no fixed rows.
BorderColor
Sets the grid's border color used when Flat=True and BorderStyle=bsSingle;
EditorBorderStyle

If set to bsNone under Windows the cell editors will not have the border, like in Delphi; set to bsSingle by default because the border can be theme specific in some widgetsets and to allow a uniform look.
FocusColor
The color used to draw the current focused cell if UseXORFeatures is not set; by default this is clRed.
FocusRectVisible
Turns on/off the drawing of focused cell.
GridLineColor
Color of grid lines in non fixed area.
GridLineStyle
Pen style used to draw lines in non fixed area, possible choices are: psSolid, psDash, psDot, psDashDot, psDashDotDot, psinsideFrame, psPattern, psClear; default is psSolid.
SelectedColor
Color used to draw cell background on selected cells.
UseXORFeatures
If set, focus rect is drawn using XOR mode so it should make visible the focus rect in combination with any cell color background. It also affects the way that moving columns look.
DefaultDrawing

(Boolean). Normally the grids prepare the grid canvas using some properties according to the kind of cell that is being painted. If the user has written an OnDrawCell event handler, DefaultDrawing (if set) also paints the cell background; if the user is taking full responsibility for drawing the cell it is better to turn off this property so painting is not duplicated. In a StringGrid, if DefaultDrawing is set it draws the text in each cell.
AutoAdvance
Where the cell cursor will go when pressing enter or tab/shift tab, or after editing.
ExtendedColSizing
If true, the user can resize columns, not just at the headers, but anywhere along the column's height.

p.b: Other properties that also affect the grid's look:

descr.p: Options: This property is a set of zero or more choices, with some elements that enable diverse functionality but others that are related directly with grid's look. Options can be set at designtime or runtime.

ul.li: goFixedVertLine, goFixedHorzLine: draws a vertical or horizontal line respectively, delimiting cells or columns in the fixed area; active by default.
goVertLine, goHorzLine: the same as previous, but for the normal browseable area. A grid can be made to simulate a listbox by unsetting both of these options.

goDrawFocusSelected: if this option is enabled, a selection background is painted in the focused cell in addition to the focused dotted rectangle (note this doesn't work yet when the
goRowSelect option is set; in such case the row is always painted as if
goDrawFocusSelected is set)
goRowSelect: selects the full row instead of individual cells
goFixedRowNumbering: if set, grid will do numbering of rows in first fixed column

goHeaderHotTracking: if set, the grid will try to show a different look when the mouse cursor is overlying any fixed cell. In order for this to work, desired cell zone needs to be enabled with the property
HeaderHotZones. Try combining this option with property
TitleStyle=
tsNative to get themed hot tracking look.

goHeaderPushedLook: if set, this option enables a pushed look when clicking any fixed cell. The zone of "pushable" cells is enabled using
HeaderPushedZones property.

descr.p: Like other custom controls, the grid is drawn using the paint method. In general terms the grid is drawn by painting all rows, and each row by painting its individual cells.
The process is as follow:

ul.li: First the visible cells area is determined: each row is tested to see if it intersects the canvas clipping region; if it's ok, then the visible area is painted by drawing columns of each row.

The column and row values are used to identify the cell that is about to be painted and again each column is tested for intersection with the clippling region; if everything is ok, some additional properties like the cell's rectangular extent and visual state are passed as arguments to the DrawCell method.

As the drawing process is running, the visual state of each cell is adjusted according to grid options and position within grid. The visual state is retained in a variable of type TGridDrawState which is a set with following elements:
gdSelected The cell will have a selected look.
gdFocused The cell will have a focused look.
gdFixed Cell have to be painted with fixed cell look.
gdHot the mouse is over this cell, so paint it with hot tracking look
gdPushed the cell is being clicked, paint it with pushed look

DrawCell. The DrawCell method is virtual and may be overriden in descendent grids to do custom drawing. The information passed to
DrawCell helps to identify which particular cell is being painted, the physical area occupied on the screen and its visible status. See
DrawCell reference for details. For each cell the following occurs:
PrepareCanvas. If the DefaultDrawing property is set, the grid canvas is setup with default properties for brush and font based on current visual state. For several design and runtime properties, the text alignment is set to match programmer selection in custom columns if they exists. If DefaultDrawing is false, brush color is set to clWindow and Font color to clWindowText, the text alignment is set with grids defaultTextStyle property value.
OnPrepareCanvas. If the programmer wrote an event handler for the
OnPrepareCanvas event, it is called at this point. This event can be used for doing simple customization like changing a cell's background color, font's properties like color, fontface and style, Text layout like different combinations of left, center, top, bottom, right alignment, etc. Any change made to the canvas for a particular cell in this event would be lost, because the next cell drawing will reset canvas again to a default state. So it's safe doing changes only for a particular cell or cells and forget about it for the rest. Using this event sometimes helps to avoid using the
OnDrawCell grid event, where users would be forced to duplicate the grid's drawing code. Todo: samples of what can be made and what to leave for OnDrawCell?
OnDrawCell. Next, if no handler for the
OnDrawCell event was specified, the grid calls the
DefaultDrawCell method which simply paints the cell background using the current canvas brush color and style.
If the
OnDrawCell handler exists, the grid first paints the cell background, but only if the
DefaultDrawing property was set; then it calls the
OnDrawCell event to do custom cell painting.
Usually programmers want to do custom drawing only for particular cells, but standard drawing for others: in this case, they can restrict custom operation to certain cell or cells by looking into
ACol, ARow and
AState arguments, and for other cells simply call the
DefaultDrawCell method and let the grid to take care of it.
Text. At this point, if the
DefaultDrawing property is true, the cell's text content is painted (only for
TStringGrid) .
Grid lines The last step for each cell is to paint the grid lines: if grid options
goVertLine, goHorzLine, goFixedVertLine and
goFixedHorzLine are specified the cell grid is drawn at this point. Grids with only rows or only cols can be obtained by changing these options. If the programmer elected to have a "themed" look it is done at this point also (see property TitleStyle).
FocusRect When all columns of the current row have been painted it is time to draw the focus rectangle for the current selected cell or for the whole row if the
goRowSelect option is set.

descr.p: The location of a grid's current (focused) cell (or row) can be changed using keyboard, mouse or through code. In order to change cell focus successfully to another position, we must test the target position to see if it is allowed to receive cell focus. When using the keyboard, AutoAdvance performs part of the process by finding what should be the next focused cell. When using mouse clicks or moving by code, focus will not move from the current cell unless the target cell is permitted to receive focus.

The grid calls SelectCell to see if a cell is focusable: if this function returns true, then the target cell identified with arguments aCol and aRow is focusable (the current implementation of TCustomGrid simply returns true). TCustomDrawGrid and hence TDrawGrid and TStringGrid override this method and check first if a cell is any wider than 0; normally you don't want a 0 width cell selected so a cell with this characteristics is skipped automatically in the process of finding a suitable cell. The overriden method SelectCell also calls the user configurable event OnSelectCell: this event receives the cell coordinates as arguments and always returns a default result of True.

Once a cell is known to be focusable and we are sure a movement will take place, the method BeforeMoveSelection is called; this in turns triggers the OnBeforeSelection event. This method's arguments are the coordinates for the new focused cell; at this point any visible editor is hidden too. The "before" word means that selection is not yet changed and current focused coordinates can be accessed with grid.Col and grid.Row properties.

After that, the internal focused cell coordinates are changed and MoveSelection is called; this method's purpose (if set) is to trigger the OnSelection event (this is a notification that the focused cell has changed and the new cell coordinates are available through grid.row and grid.col properties).

Note that is not good to use the OnSelectCell event to detect cell focus changes, as this event will be triggered several times even for the same cell in the process of finding a suitable cell. Is better to use OnBeforeSelection or OnSelection events for this purpose.
Users can specify what editor will be used for a cell using one of two methods.

ol.li:
Using a custom column and selecting the ButtonStyle property of the column. In this method the user can select the style of the editor that will be shown. Available values are:
cbsAuto, cbsEllipsis, cbsNone, cbsPickList, cbsCheckboxColumn.

Using the OnSelectEditor grid event. Here the user specifies in the
Editor parameter which editor to use for a cell identified by
aCol,
ARow in a
TCustomDrawGrid derived grid or
TColumn in
TCustomDBGrid. The public
EditorByStyle() function takes as parameter one of the following values:
cbsAuto, cbsEllipsis, cbsNone, cbsPickList, cbsCheckboxColumn.
This method takes precedence over the first one using custom columns. A Custom cell editor can be specified here, with values specific to the cell, row or column.

descr.p: The following is a description of the editor styles. They are enumerated values of type TColumnButtonStyle and so they are prefixed by 'cbs'. This type was used to remain compatible with Delphi's DBGrid.

ul.li: cbsAuto This is the default editor style for TCustomGrid derived grids. The TStringCellEditor derived from TCustomMaskEdit is specialized to edit single line strings and is used by default in TStringGrid and TDrawGrid. When using Custom Columns, if the programmer filled the Column's PickList property, this behaves as if cbsPickList editor style was set. For a TCustomDBGrid that has a field of type boolean, it behaves as if cbsCheckBoxColumn editor style was specified. This is the recommended value for Custom Cell Editors. TODO: related OnEditingDone.

cbsEllipsis This editor style is the most generic one. A button with ellipsis (...) appears in the editing cell and the programmer can use the OnEditButtonClick grid event to take any programmed action when the user presses the button. For example a calendar dialog could pop up to allow the user to select a specific date, a file open dialog could appear to find files, or a calculator could appear so the user could enter the numeric result of calculations, etc.
OnEditButtonClick is just a notification, to find out in which cell a button has been clicked by taking a look at the grid.Row and grid.Col properties.
A DBGrid has specific properties to retrieve the active column or field and because this event occurs in the active record, it could update the information in the active field.
This editor style is implemented using TButtonCellEditor, a direct descendant of TButton.
cbsNone This editor style instructs the grid not to use any editor for a specific cell or column; it behaves then, as if the grid were readonly for such a cell or column.

cbsPickList Used to present the user with a list of values that can be entered. This editor style is implemented using TPickListCellEditor, a component derived from TCustomComboBox. The list of values that are shown is filled in one of two ways depending on the method used to select the editor style.
When using custom columns, programmers can enter a list of values using the column's PickList property. [FOR BEGINNERS: TODO: exact procedure to edit the list]

cbsCheckboxColumn This editor style is at the moment only available in TDBGrid. If a field's contents associated with the column are restricted to a pair of values, for example, yes-no, true-false, on-off, 1-0, etc then cbsCheckboxColumn is used to modify the apearance of a column by using a checkbox representation that the user can toggle by using a mouse click or pressing the SPACE key.
If a columns' ButtonStyle property is set to cbsAuto and DBGrid detects that the field associated with the column is a boolean field, then the grid uses this editor style automatically. This automatic selection can be disabled or enabled using DBGrid's OptionsExtra property; setting dgeCheckboxColumn element to false disables this feature.
The values that are used to recognize the checked or unchecked states are set in a column's properties ValueChecked and ValueUnchecked.
At any moment, the field value can be in one to three states: Unchecked, Checked or Grayed.

element.name: TStringCellEditor.msg_SetPos
element.short: msg_SetPos - issues message for specifying position

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_SetBounds
element.short: msg_SetBounds - issues message for specifying bounds

element.name: TButtonCellEditor.msg_Ready
element.short: msg_Ready - issues message when ready

element.name: TPickListCellEditor.msg_SetPos
element.short: msg_SetPos - issues a message to specify the position

element.name: TEditorItem
element.short: TEditorItem - a single item on which a Composite Cell Editor operates

element.name: TEditorItem.Editor
element.short: The Editor to be used for this item

element.name: TEditorItem.Align
element.short: Align - how this item is to be aligned

element.name: TEditorItem.ActiveControl
element.short: ActiveControl - returns True if this item is part of an active control

element.name: TCompositeCellEditor
element.short: TCompositeCellEditor - a general purpose editor for cells in a grid

element.name: TCompositeCellEditor.msg_GetValue
element.short: msg_GetValue - issues a message to find the value

element.name: TCompositeCellEditor.msg_SetGrid
element.short: msg_SetGrid - issues message for specifying grid

element.name: TCompositeCellEditor.msg_SetValue
element.short: msg_SetValue - issues a message to specify the value

element.name: TCompositeCellEditor.msg_SetBounds
element.short: msg_SetBounds - issues message for specifying bounds

element.name: TCompositeCellEditor.msg_SetMask
element.short: msg_SetMask - issues message for specifying mask

element.name: TCompositeCellEditor.msg_SelectAll
element.short: msg_SelectAll - issues message for Selecting All

element.name: TCompositeCellEditor.CMControlChange
element.short: CMControlChange - issues Control Message for a change in a control

element.name: TCompositeCellEditor.msg_SetPos
element.short: msg_SetPos - issues a message to specify the position

element.name: TCompositeCellEditor.SendChar
element.short: SendChar - transmits the specified character and returns an integer status result

element.name: TCompositeCellEditor.AddEditor
element.short: AddEditor - adds the specified Editor with the given alignment and specified ActiveControl propery

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.ImageIndex
element.short: ImageIndex - the index for any image to be used in the title (default=0, ie no image)

element.name: TGridColumnTitle.ImageLayout
element.short: ImageLayout - the layout to use for any image in the title

element.name: TCustomGrid.AdjustEditorBounds
element.short: AdjustEditorBounds - method to adjust the editor's bounds to include a new row and column

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawColumnTitleImage
element.short: DrawColumnTitleImage - draw the title image of the specified column

element.name: TCustomGrid.EditingAllowed
element.short: EditingAllowed - Returns true if grid and current column allow editing

element.name: TCustomGrid.TitleImageList
element.short: TitleImageList - the list of images to be used with the titles

element.name: TGridColumn.GetValueChecked
element.short: GetValueChecked - returns a checked value as a string

element.name: TGridColumn.GetValueUnchecked
element.short: GetValueUnchecked - returns an unchecked value as a string

element.name: TGridColumn.ValueChecked
element.short: ValueChecked - a string value of a checked item

element.name: TGridColumn.ValueUnchecked
element.short: ValueUnchecked - a string value of an unchecked item

element.name: TCustomGrid.DrawGridCheckboxBitmaps
element.short: DrawGridCheckboxBitmaps - draws checkbox bitmaps in the nominated rectangle with the specified checkbox state

element.name: TCustomGrid.OnUserCheckboxBitmap
element.short: OnUserCheckboxBitmap - event handler for a user accessing a checkbox bitmap

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.GetCheckBoxState
element.short: GetCheckBoxState - returns the state of the checkbox at the specified position

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.SetCheckboxState
element.short: SetCheckboxState - specifies the state of the checkbox in the nominated cell

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.ToggleCheckbox
element.short: ToggleCheckbox - toggles checkbox state between checked and unchecked

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnGetCheckboxState
element.short: OnGetCheckboxState - event handler for finding checkbox state

element.name: TCustomDrawGrid.OnSetCheckboxState
element.short: OnSetCheckboxState - event handler for specifying checkbox state

element.name: TGridColumn.GetDefaultValueChecked
element.short: GetDefaultValueChecked - returns the default value for a checked column

element.name: TGridColumn.GetDefaultValueUnchecked
element.short: GetDefaultValueUnchecked - returns the default value for an unchecked column
